channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jerry Adler, "Sopranos" and "The Good Wife" actor, dies at 96
item.description: Jerry Adler's acting credits include "The Sopranos" and "The Good Wife." He also had 53 Broadway productions to his name, all behind the scenes.

item.title: SpaceX calls off Super Heavy-Starship test flight after ground systems trouble
item.description: Taking no chances, SpaceX called off an attempt to launch its huge Super Heavy-Starship rocket after running into problems with ground equipment.

item.title: Ukraine marks Independence Day as Vance says Russia has made " significant concessions"
item.description: Russia accused Ukraine of launching drone attacks that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant in its western Kursk region overnight Sunday.

item.title: Ukraine marks its Independence Day as war with Russia continues
item.description: A defiant Ukraine marked its independence from the former Soviet Union Sunday amid more fighting with Russia. Chris Livesay reports on how world leade...

item.title: 8/24: Face the Nation
item.description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," as President Trump has deployed federal authorities in Washington, D.C., Margaret Brennan speaks...

item.title: Millions in West facing dangerous heatwave amid multiple wildfires
item.description: Parts of California, Oregon and Washington state will experience extreme heat at least through Tuesday, forecasters said.

item.title: It was the costliest hurricane in U.S. history: Have we forgotten Katrina's lessons?
item.description: Nearly 1,400 people died after Hurricane Katrina crashed into Louisiana and Mississippi. Most of the deaths were in New Orleans, which has had an unev...

item.title: Illinois officials blast Trump's threat to deploy National Guard in Chicago
item.description: Earlier in August, Trump deployed hundreds of National Guard members to Washington, D.C., as part of what he touted as an effort to reduce crime and r...

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia expects to be detained by ICE again, attorney says
item.description: The lawyer for Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man wrongly deported by the Trump administration to an El Salvadoran prison and then returned months later, s...

item.title: SpaceX postpones 10th test launch of massive Starship rocket
item.description: SpaceX wants to put the two-stage rocket's massive booster through its paces. On Sunday, it postponed the launch "to troubleshoot an issue with ground...

item.title: Israel hits Yemen's Houthis after reports group used cluster bomb
item.description: The strikes come after Israel said the Houthis used cluster munitions in a missile fired at Israel.

item.title: Floods keep ravaging Pakistan - how can it protect itself?
item.description: In June of this year alone, monsoon rains have killed at least 750 people across the country.

item.title: Zelensky vows to continue fighting as Ukraine marks independence day
item.description: Russia said power and energy facilities had been targeted by Ukraine, which accused Russia of "spreading manipulations".

item.title: Pentagon says some Guard units in Washington are now carrying firearms. Trump targets more cities
‘KPop Demon Hunters’ gives Netflix its first box-office win
item.description: Rival studios on Sunday estimated that the Netflix film, “KPop Demon Hunters” led all films in the box office this weekend with $16-18 million in tick...

item.title: UK's Chagos Islands deal 'significant victory', says Pope
item.description: Pope Leo XIV said he hoped Mauritian authorities would ensure the refugees are able to return home.

item.title: Inside Donetsk as residents flee attacks on Ukrainian region Putin wants to control
item.description: Quentin Sommerville follows volunteers carrying out evacuations in eastern Ukraine as drone attacks rage.

item.title: Texas Gov. Abbott says he’ll swiftly sign new maps on his desk that will boost GOP in 2026
